reference.shortdesc: The equation-figure element is a container for equations and their supporting information.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Equation figures can have titles, descriptions, figure groups, and all other figure components. The direct children of equation-figure can be the equation content itself (for example, mathml or an image reference), or it can be one or more equation-block elements, along with other elements allowed within figures.
When an equation-figure element has multiple direct child mathml, equation-block, image, or pre elements, each child represents an alternative form of the equation.
When the intent is to combine equations and commentary within an equation-figure, use child equation-block elements to contain the equations and so clearly distinguish them from the commentary.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Equation figures can be numbered. Either standard figure numbering can be used, or equation-number elements can be placed within equation-block elements.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The equation-figure element is specialized from fig. It is defined in the equation domain module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: and .

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how an equation-figure element can contain both MathML content and commentary. The MathML content is contained with a nested equation-block element, and it is followed by commentary that is contained in a nested p element.

p.codeblock:
An equation with commentary n! r! ( n−r ) !

Where r is greater than 1.
